result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan V Cerasoli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $150.36 to Walmart to be paid as a condition of probation with cases 16CM0830 and 16CM1018, Joint and Several.

DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation with cases 16CM0830 and 16CM1018.
Costs waived.
First 3 months Straight time (without Huber) to commence FORTHWITH.  Last 5 months with Huber. Sentence credit 42 days were granted.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Megan V Cerasoli in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.

Court orders the following:  Count #1

Imposes:  8 months jail.  1st 3 months without huber.  Last 5 months with huber.  (42 days credit).  

Defendant to provide a DNA Sample

$200.00 DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation with cases 16CM830 and 16CM1018. 

Costs: WAIVED.  

Restitution:  $150.36 to Walmart to be paid as a condition of probation with cases 16CM830 and 16CM1018.  Joint and Several.

Defendant Megan V Cerasoli in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner advises there is a new offer based on additional new read in charges.  Attorney Weitzner is still waiting on a response from the State.  Attorney Weitzner is requesting additional time to speak with his client.  Court grants the request to adjourn the plea hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Court adjourns the plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
